Dear Ms. Norton:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.

Sincerely,

ALLEGATION:
Agency used images of a child in foster care without permission.
INVESTIGATION:
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via telephone on May 26, 2022. CA
reported the agency became aware an image of a foster child was taken sometime
last summer. The image was used by their philanthropy department on social media,
specifically, Facebook, as well as a mass mailing. CA stated the youth in the image
is a temporary court ward and permission was not requested from the biological
parent. CA stated once the agency became aware they removed the image from
Facebook and sought permission from the biological mother.
Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) was interviewed via telephone on June 9, 2022.
CCO stated the agency held an event called Confident Kids in August 2021. CCO
stated Youth A’s image was taken during the event and the agency philanthropy
2

department used it on the agency Facebook page as well as an in-office newsletter.
CCO reported the Child Welfare Program Manager noticed the newsletter and
questioned whether a release from a biological parent had been obtained prior to
using Youth A’s image. CCO stated the agency determined there was not a release
on file to use Youth A’s image. CCO stated the agency recently obtained a release
from Youth A’s biological mother to use the image. The agency explained to
biological mother the timeline of events and the reason for the request. CCO stated
the agency employees in the philanthropy department who used Youth A's image
are no longer with the agency. CCO stated since this incident the agency is working
on updating internal protocol for ensuring this does not happen again in the future.
Child Welfare Program Manager (CWPM) was interviewed via telephone on June
16, 2022. CWPM stated all of the staff at the agency received a mailing and noticed
an image of Youth A. CWPM and other staff present questioned whether or not the
agency had a release to use Youth A’s image because he is not a permanent court
ward. It was determined the agency did not have a release to use Youth A’s image.
CWPM stated she first saw the mailing approximately 3 weeks ago, but the image
was taken sometime last summer. CWPM stated the agency contacted Youth A’s
biological mother and was able to obtain a release to use the image.
Biological mother was not able to be interviewed. Two attempts to contact her via
telephone on June 16, 2022, were unsuccessful. She did not answer and there is no
voicemail set up. A follow up text message was sent on June 16, 2022; however,
she did not respond.
Documents Reviewed:
 Consent form for videotaping/photography request for Youth A’s image to be
used on marketing pamphlet from Confident Kids event. Consent form is
signed by Youth A’s biological mother and dated May 31, 2022.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12211 Privacy safeguard.
(3) An agency shall obtain the written consent of a parent or
legal guardian before using a child, a picture of a child, or a
child's name in any form of agency publicity.
ANALYSIS: The agency is found in non-compliance as they acknowledge
they used Youth A’s image on social media and in an office
mailing without obtaining a release from a biological parent. The
agency has since obtained a release from Youth A’s biological
mother.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
